column4: sorry to ask again, but... i'm trying to run the live ubuntu 6.10 cd for the first time and i get an error message "Failed to start the x server... it is likely that it is not set up correctly." i have no idea what the problem or where to begin looking... any advice?
there could be a number of reasons for that error, type "tail /var/log/Xorg.0.log" in a console
I don't know how it handles logs
you could do that I guess, otoh it's hard to know if you will get X running afterwards if we don't know what the reason for the live cd failing is
think of it as the textbased interface
before you were looking at what should be X/gnome but failed
if you need more than one
can you paste your log to that site?
anythings possible, dunno if the odds are good though
Only thing I can see is that it can't find your graphics card, can't really say why
then there's some command you can do to dump your pci info, but I don't remember it
